page.title: 15RELIGION - SYDMONTON AREA.
page.content: RELIGION DOES NOT PLAY AN IMPORTANT PART IN THE LIFE OF MANY PEOPLE TODAY. ST. MARY'S CHURCH AT SYDMONTON WAS BUILT IN 1853 TO REPLACE AN OLD CHAPEL OF THE 12th CENTURY AND WAS WELL ATTENDED AT ONE TIME. LESS PEOPLE ARE EMPLOYED IN THE COUNTRY THESE DAYS WITH MECHANISATION, AND WHEN SYDMONTON COURT WAS SOLD, THE CHURCH WENT WITH IT. SADLY, THE PRESENT OWNER HAS HAD IT DE-CONSECRATED AND NOW USES IT FOR HIS OWN PRIVATE CONCERTS. THERE IS STILL A CHURCH IN ECCHINSWELL AND SEVERAL PEOPLE FROM THIS AREA ATTEND SERVICES THERE. GENERALLY THE CHURCH OF ENGLAND IS THE RELIGION OF THOSE WHO STILL FOLLOW THE CUSTOM.
